title: Timeline of Calgary history
text:
This is a timeline of the history of <a href="Calgary">Calgary</a>.
List of riots and civil unrest in Calgary.
The following is a timeline of riots and civil unrest in <a href="Calgary">Calgary</a>, <a href="Alberta">Alberta</a>. Since its incorporation as a town in 1884, like other cities, Calgary has had to deal with a variety of violence. Calgary has been credited with maintaining relative civility during duress. The <a href="Great%20Depression%20in%20Canada">Great Depression in Canada</a> has received particular attention from <a href="Sociology">sociologists</a> and historians, including Thomas Thorner and Neil Watson who wrote, "There is little question that Calgary experienced its share of civil strife during the Depression. Battles between police and the single unemployed men, full scale riots and threats to blow up public buildings appear to have been almost annual events." According to Stephen Graham, a Professor of Human Geography at <a href="Durham%20University">Durham University</a>, recent events have seen the City of Calgary change their tactics towards civil unrest activities such as protests.
